Repository Guidelines

Source: AGENTS.md

Project Structure & Module Organization

nhstt is an R data package providing tidy access to NHS Talking Therapies reports. Core functions live in R/, exported APIs governed via NAMESPACE, and roxygen comments regenerate man/. Tests sit in tests/testthat/ following test-{name}.R convention.

Key directories: - inst/nhstt_data/raw_config.toml - Source URLs, formats, periods - R/tidy-config-*.R - Per-dataset transformation configs - tests/testthat/fixtures/schemas/ - Raw/tidy schema fixtures (5 rows, all columns) - Cache: tools::R_user_dir("nhstt", "cache")

Update README.Rmd rather than README.md; knitting produces the public README.

Build, Test, and Development Commands

Always start R with R --quiet --vanilla. Typical workflow:

R --quiet --vanilla -e "devtools::load_all()"    # Reload for interactive dev
R --quiet --vanilla -e "devtools::test()"        # Run tests (must complete <5s)
R --quiet --vanilla -e "devtools::document()"    # Regenerate docs
R --quiet --vanilla -e "styler::style_pkg()"     # Format code
R --quiet --vanilla -e "pkgdown::build_site()"   # Rebuild docs site

Critical: Tests must run in under 5 seconds. No integration tests - only fast unit tests using fixtures.

Coding Style & Naming Conventions

Use tidyverse style: 2-space indents, snake_case objects, sentence-case headings. Roxygen2 comments must precede each exported function; run devtools::document() after any roxygen edit and keep _pkgdown.yml in sync. Use cli::cli_abort()/cli::cli_warn() with UK English spelling.

Architecture Overview

Two separate config systems: - raw_config.toml - Source URLs, formats, periods, development flags - R/tidy-config-*.R - Transformation logic (filters, derivations, output)

Pipeline flow: 1. Raw data acquisition: raw_config.toml → download_raw() → read_raw() → parquet/csv cache 2. Tidy transformation: tidy_config_*() → tidy_dataset() → prepare_tidy_data() → parquet cache 3. User access: get_*_annual() / get_*_monthly() → combined tidy tibble

Config-driven design: New datasets require only config additions, not new pipeline code.

Development Workflow

Use development = true flag in raw_config.toml to explore new periods before exposing to users:

[[datasets.key_measures.annual.sources]]
period = "2025-26"
url = "https://..."
development = true

Behaviour: - list_available_periods() excludes development periods - get_*() functions error if user requests development period - read_raw() works with development periods via devtools::load_all()

Testing Guidelines

Critical: Tests must complete in under 5 seconds

  • All new code requires a test in tests/testthat/test-{name}.R
  • Use fixtures (5 rows, all columns) stored in tests/testthat/fixtures/schemas/
  • Run with devtools::test() or devtools::test_file("tests/testthat/test-foo.R")
  • Tests must run offline - no network calls
  • Use load_raw_data() helper to load fixtures for tidy tests
  • Add schema checks for every dataset and period

Test organisation: - test-raw-config.R - Raw config validation and source info - test-tidy-config.R - Tidy config validation and ALL tidy_dataset() tests - test-tidy-utils.R - Helper functions - test-cache.R - Cache management - test-raw.R - Raw data utilities

Adding a New Dataset

  1. Add source to raw_config.toml
  2. Create R/tidy-config-{dataset}.R with config function
  3. Register in tidy_config_registry (R/tidy-config.R)
  4. Create user-facing function in R/tidy-annual.R or R/tidy-monthly.R
  5. Create fixtures: tests/testthat/fixtures/schemas/{frequency}/{dataset}/raw/{period}.csv
  6. Add tests to tests/testthat/test-tidy-config.R

Adding a New Period

  1. Add source to raw_config.toml with development = true
  2. Explore via devtools::load_all() then read_raw("dataset", "period", "frequency")
  3. Add override to R/tidy-config-{dataset}.R if schema changed (period is the list name)
  4. Update fixtures if needed
  5. Test and remove development = true

Commit & Pull Request Guidelines

Write small, imperative commits (fix, Refactor, Run styler::style_pkg()). Bundle generated artefacts (man/, NAMESPACE, docs/) with source changes. PRs should describe affected NHS periods, reference issues, and list commands run (styler, devtools::test(), R CMD check, pkgdown::check_pkgdown()). Include screenshots when documentation or pkgdown output changes.
